value.title: Convert UTC datetime to local time zones in Power Query
value.excerpt: In today's video I will show you how to have power query change from utc time to local time so you can follow #FIFAWWC #FIFAWomensWorldCup in your own timezone. #curbal #powerbi #powerquery  Here are the resources mentioned in the video: https://curbal.com/blog/follow-the-fifa-world-cup-2018-in-power-bi

value.title: DAX Fridays! #20: Parent and Child Functions -Hierarchies
value.excerpt: In this video we will go through how to work with hierarchies using the following DAX functions: PATH, PATHLENGTH, PATHITEM, PATHITEMREVERSE, PATHCONTAINS  The example used will be a simplified bill of materials (BOM) but in the microsoft documentation, there is an excellent example for employees and

value.title: DAX Fridays! #74: PREVIOUSDAY, PREVIOUSMONTH, PREVIOUSQUARTER, PREVIOUSYEAR
value.excerpt: In todayâ€™s video I we will go through how to build a time intelligence measure in DAX using the PREVIOUSDAY, PREVIOUSMONTH, PREVIOUSQUARTER, PREVIOUSYEAR.  We will first go through PREVIOUSYEAR DAX function and explain how can those functions can be combined with CALCULATE to create the correct measure.

value.title: DAX Fridays! #77: GROUPBY, CURRENTGROUP
value.excerpt: In today's DAX Fridays, we will go through the DAX function GROUPBY with an example.  GROUPBY is similar as SUMMARIZE, but the difference is that in the expression part, you use DAX iterators to get your results. You can also nest GROUPBY functions to get for example the highest sales amount by country.

value.title: DAX Fridays! #81: CALCULATETABLE
value.excerpt: In todays video we are going to cover the DAX function CALCULATETABLE.  CALCULATETABLE allows you to create virtual tables that you can then filter using multiple conditions and use that table to make further calculations.   What is the difference between CALCULATETABLE and CALCULATE?  The first one
